feed.title: Git-Sync Releases

entry.title: New release for Git-Sync: v0.6.3
entry.content:
Changelog

  • 05cad4cfd6bcd1be639dc131697d157d8b0f9805 build: :arrow_up: upgrade go to 1.22.6
  • dbf3ebc5a16ae55177c18203657677c5fee5fb60 chore(deps): update golang docker tag to v1.22.6
  • 23c49a9aa68d1660a5127b0f3ba7b1802f090df2 chore(deps): update module golang.org/x/oauth2 to v0.22.0
  • f41a6f3f84ed521cab2bfeb6a39e09abd97d057c chore: :memo: remove header from release
  • 9c0000238cfb702c2d83f3451706b84953440a4b ci: :wrench: add discussion write permission to the ci job

entry.title: New release for Git-Sync: v0.7.0
entry.content:
What's New!

With this release, now we have a new CLI flag called cron. With this now you don't need to set up cronjob directly on your system (you still can, no one is stopping you) but with the new flag you can set up cronjobs more seamlessly. More details about this is added on the Wiki Page

Changelog

  • 913b64bfa793d6696b9a03123654ce7768cce5f9 chore: :wrench: remove append mode from goreleaser config
  • 7299582c472bfa5a6698b4c7e8f91a6aa4d38f81 feat: :sparkles: add support for setting up cron job via new arg "cron"
  • cae4fe57a8fb307441c3609e9f7953379fade079 feat: :sparkles: allow setting up cron expression from config file as well

entry.title: New release for Git-Sync: v0.8.0
entry.content:
What's New

With this release, now git-sync allows users to be able to synchronize not just code repositories but also Wiki's! üéâ To include wiki's in your backup process, add the include_wiki to true in your config file.

‚ö†Ô∏è Breaking Change

While the addition of new config key include_wiki is optional, the breaking change is about the folder structure on your local system where the backups are created. The new structure will be like this: - Repo: backup_dir -> RepoOwner -> RepoName -> RepoName.git - Wiki: backup_dir -> RepoOwner -> RepoName -> RepoName.wiki.git

To ensure you have a smooth transition, it is advised that you can just choose a different backup_dir and start fresh or if you already have access to your backed up codebases then feel free to delete those and start fresh. In the first run, git-sync will start with cloning process as per the new directory structure.

Changelog

  • 159a6287f08835150dc5c1e511413ed1f9dc3720 feat: :sparkles: sync repo wiki as well
  • b8c9d17369897a1e589b878f959b424e75e09e10 feat: :wrench: control including wiki for backups via option in config file

entry.title: New release for Git-Sync: v0.8.1
entry.content:
Changelog

  • 6a7bc77d4e065909869a85e4a507512ca1618531 feat: :wrench: better way to catch wiki not found error and set warning only for that case.
  • a095e7d6945aceceb72b4cfbaa84f3290361c9ff feat: :wrench: warning log when cloning wiki fails
